entry.title: How to Get List of DNS Servers Linux Is Using
entry.content:
To get the list of DNS server which Linux is currently referring to use:

nmcli dev list | grep DNS

entry.title: How to Get List of Files Inside a Tar Archive in Linux
entry.content:
Get the list of files inside a tar archive in Linux using command line tar command:

tar --list -f archive.tar.gz

entry.title: Search and Replace Commands in Linux
entry.content:
Sed command does a great job for search and replace, let’s see an example:

sed -i -- 's/foo/bar/g' myfile.txt

This will convert the string “foo” to “bar” in myfile.txt, if you would like to perform this on all files use:

sed -i -- 's/foo/bar/g' *

The same can be done recursively using find command:

find . -type f -exec sed -i 's/foo/bar/g' {} +

entry.title: How to Resize a Image in Linux
entry.content:
Linux’s convert command line tool can be used to convert between image formats as well as resize an image, let’s see how to resize an image:

convert my_picture.png -resize 200x100 my_picture_200x100.jpg

entry.title: How to Extract Bz2 Archives in Linux
entry.content:
tar command can be used to extract bz2 archives, example:

tar -cvjSf folder.tar.bz2 folder
